website_summaries.verdict: Durable construction that should give you a good value over the long term.
pros: Offered in 5 different sizes, so you can find just the right product for your needs
Exterior consists of a polyester-coated vinyl for good longevity
Works well for practicing for jujitsu, wrestling, or MMA
Will absorb strikes and throws without showing wear and tear
Includes instructions to help you get started
cons: Unfilled design so you'll need to find a filler material

customer_reviews.title: Good size for big boys
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and came with instructions. My son has practiced a few moves on it and likes it. He is 11 and we probably filled it to be around 40 lbs for him to be able to lift. An unfilled dummy is best for us since we can add weight as he grows. Also saves shipping cost. The fabric on this is tough. I don't see it ever ripping or blowing open. Cotton is the best fabric to use for filling as it is the heaviest. We only gave it 4 stars because we haven't taken it to a ring and used it alot yet.
customer_reviews.author: AVIF

customer_reviews.title: Awesome throwing dummy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to practice takedowns. He loves it. It holds up really well. I bought my own as well.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Having a good way to get the arms to stand out/ forward ...
customer_reviews.text: Stuffing them is an issue. Since this is the first time, it's hard to know exactly what to do. The instruction are minimal. Having a good way to get the arms to stand out/ forward instead of drooping. Any suggestions ? I used cloth pieces and actually some rubber mulch (tires) to add a it more weight. Then tying the strings was difficult- especially the last part and trying knot it off. But the kids are having fun, so it is worth it. Warren B
customer_reviews.author: wb

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Used a big box of pillow stuffing from Michael's craft store instead of rags. Much lighter and easier to practice moves.
customer_reviews.author: Canadia

customer_reviews.title: Grappling Buddy
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my husband. He loves it. It has durability, solid and easy to use. It perfect to work on moves.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Great dummy bag.
customer_reviews.text: Had a few years could only fill to about 90 lbs . Takes a beating really well and holds up
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: it's great throwing and punching a dummy who doesn't comment back
customer_reviews.author: martial atrs & yoga 2

customer_reviews.title: It is not dtuffed
customer_reviews.text: The dummy is tough and as advertised. But trust me if you can buy a pre-stuffed one, do it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Y.

customer_reviews.title: Totally useless. Tried to contact seller
customer_reviews.text: Dummy was not as described. Described as 5'4' yet was only 4'5'. Totally useless. Tried to contact seller, no response...Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: MartialD

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy construction. I will have to see how it ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy construction. I will have to see how it holds up. It takes a lot of clothes to get this thing stuffed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Hamm

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone who is or has grapplers in the family should have one. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy

customer_reviews.title: Very rugged and exactly as advertised. For stuffing we ...
customer_reviews.text: Very rugged and exactly as advertised. For stuffing we purchased 10 cheap pillows from Walmart and used the stuffing from them, worked out very well.
customer_reviews.author: BigD

customer_reviews.title: For some reason, I thought it would be stuffed ...
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, I thought it would be stuffed. I had to find some old clothes to stuff it myself. It's very durable but not too flexible and its kind of hard.
customer_reviews.author: mnid007

customer_reviews.title: Not versatile enough.
customer_reviews.text: This dummy has good solid construction, but I wish there was some way to hang it up. It would be perfect then!
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN WINTEROWD-LAUGHMAN

product_meta.title: Unfilled MMA Grappling Throwing Dummy 30lbs to 140lbs, for MMA, Grappling, Jiu Jitsu, Wrestling
product_meta.description:
Unfilled. 

Our MMA Grappling dummies are made of very durable polyester coated vinyl providing same durability as leather, Ideal training tool to practice take downs, throws, submissions and strikes without having any fear of injuring to a training partner, great product for MMA, Jiu Jitsu and Wrestling. 

Available in 5 different sizes/weights, please note this listing is for UnFilled dummies: 

3’6” 30lbs 
4’5” 50lbs 
5’6” 75lbs 
5’8” 110lbs 
5’10” 140lbs
feature_bullets: Our MMA Grappling dummies are made of very durable polyester coated vinyl providing same durability as leather, Ideal training tool to practice take downs, throws, submissions and strikes without having any fear of injuring to a training partner, great product for MMA, Jiu Jitsu and Wrestling.
Available in 5 different sizes/weights, please note this listing is for UnFilled dummies: 3’6” 30lbs, 5’4” 50lbs, 5’6” 75lbs, 5’8” 110lbs, 5’10” 140lbs
